attributes.action: Force oil companies to pass on low oil prices at the pumps
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Today (20th November), global oil prices fell below $50, yet diesel prices are still extortionatly overpriced.  On 18th October 2007, Oil prices stood at $88 a barrel (Source: BBC News Archive), yet, diesel prices stood at 99.9p.  Fuel companies are clearly extorting the public, with their pricing, and should not be allowed to continue.  Petrol continues to decrease in price, why has diesel hit a plateau?
